thread.title: Tourist 'truly sorry' for posing nude on sacred mountain
thread.title_full: Tourist 'truly sorry' for posing nude on sacred mountain

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Tourist 'truly sorry' for posing nude on sacred mountain
text:
Tourist 'truly sorry' for posing nude on sacred mountain Adv: Malaysia 'nude photo' woman Eleanor Hawkins 'truly sorry' Adv: 
LONDON, England - Eleanor Hawkins has returned to UK and apologized to the people of Malaysia for having posed topless on a sacred mountain. 
The student, who served a three-day jail term in Malaysia's Sabah state before being set free, says she knows her actions had been wrong. 
She said today that "I know my behavior was foolish and I know how much offence we all caused to the local people of Sabah. For that, I am truly sorry." 
Hawkins was one of four foreigners charged in Malaysia after removing their clothes and posing for a photograph on Mount Kinabalu. 
The 23-year-old seemed near tears as she read a statement outside her family's home in Draycott, 195 kilometres north of London. She says she's relieved to be home.
